Title: Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Pandemic: An Overview of Systematic Reviews

Title: COVID-19 clinical characteristics, and sex-specific risk of mortality: Systematic Review and Meta-analysis
Study population: Methods: We reviewed the scientific literature published from January 1, 2019 to March 3, 2020.
Sample Text: A total of 4789 patients with a mean age of 49 years were evaluated.

Title: Prevalence of comorbidities and its effects in patients infected with SARS-CoV-2: a systematic review and meta-analysis
Study population: A systematic search was conducted on studies published from January 1, 2019 to February 25, 2020 in PubMed, EMBASE, and Web of Science databases.
Sample Text: As of February 25, 2020, a total of 1 576 participants were included in our meta-analysis.
Matches: The most prevalent comorbidities were hypertension (21.1%, 95% CI: 13.0–27.2%) and diabetes (9.7%, 95% CI: 7.2–12.2%), followed by cardiovascular disease (8.4%, 95% CI: 3.8–13.8%) and respiratory system disease (1.5%, 95% CI: 0.9–2.1%).

Title: Clinical Characteristics of Imported Cases of COVID-19 in Jiangsu Province: A Multicenter Descriptive Study
Study population: METHODS: We retrospectively investigated the clinical, imaging, and laboratory characteristics of confirmed cases of COVID-19 with WHO interim guidance in three Grade ⅢA hospitals of Jiangsu from Jan 22 to Feb 14, 2020.
Sample Text: RESULTS: Of the 80 patients infected with COVID-19, 41 patients were female, with a median age of 46.1 years.
